newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Cont Mariner places shrs to buy property.
newsitem.headline: Cont Mariner places shrs to buy property.

text.p: Trading in red chip Continental Mariner Investment Co Ltd will resume on Monday, after a company announcement saying the company had raised HK$256 million to buy two properties from its parent.

The company said it would buy floor space in the Shanghai Stock Exchange Building, including the whole of the 24th and 25th levels, for a consideration of US$38 million (HK$296.40 million), the statement said.

The seller had guaranteed the company an annual rental income from this property of not less than US$4.56 million (HK$35.57 million) for two years, representing an annual rental yield of approximately 12 percent, it said.

The company was also buying a 75 percent stake in Poly Plaza Ltd, a sino-foreign equity joint venture whose major asset in the Beijing property, the Poly Plaza, for a total consideration of 207.22 million yuan (HK$193.66 million), it said.
The company had also received a guaranteed return on this project of 12 percent for 10 years, it said.

The company also said it was only considering one other future investment at this time, a project with the Water Authority of Fuyang in Zhejiang province to provide water supplies to the public in Fuyang, the statement said.
The total proposed investment in this project would be between US$8 million (HK$62.4 million) and US$10 million (HK$78 million), it said. -- Hong Kong newsroom (852) 2843 6933 http://www.hk97.com
